VM Host Cluster
The VM Host Cluster represents a collection of physical servers that work together to host virtual machines.
In the Technology Architecture layer:
• A VM Host Cluster is typically modeled as a grouping of physical server nodes (also called hosts or hypervisors) • Each physical server in the cluster is a Node element in ArchiMate terminology • These servers collectively provide the computing resources (CPU, memory) needed to run virtual machines • The clustering allows for features like high availability, load balancing, and resource pooling
Function: Provides virtualized computing resources
Relationships:
 Runs → Clinical Applications, Administrative Applications  Uses → Hypervisor Platform: For virtualization  Connected to → Core Network: At 40/100 Gbps  Accesses → Storage SAN: For data storage
